etymons.notes: tuh tuh cf. Lane 319: a cry by which one chides the camel

Preterit.text: aḥna kulan mtahtáhle-lan b-i=briṯo ʻuns hat er alle in alle Welt auseinandergetriebenʼ; 802; 57/120; naḥət w mlele qum ṣadre kefe w rahəṭ lak kalbe (...) mtahtahle ak kalbe 'He went down and gathered some stones in front of his chest and ran towards the dogs. He dispersed the dogs.' 2018_07_06_au_005_MuA_Story_about_Quzko: 66-68
